text:
Hi,

it seems to me that there is a bug.

I cannot reference images with absolute pathes like I can do this for SSI 
(without referencing the ROOT, so that the html-pages are still portable). 
Absolute pathes work since http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?
id=4326.

In server.xml (I let Tomcat Root Context in comments) I added:
<!-- ANT Context -->
<Context path="/ANT" docBase="ANT" debug="0" privileged="true"/>
                ^^^ ANT is the name of my application

in web.xml of my app (ANT) I added:
<servlet>
<servlet-name>ssi</servlet-name>
<servlet-class>org.apache.catalina.servlets.SsiInvokerServlet</servlet-class >>
<init-param>
<param-name>isVirtualWebappRelative</param-name>
<param-value>1</param-value>
</init-param>
</servlet>

In my html-page I reference the SSI as follows and it works now (since 
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=4326 rsp. with patch 
24102001):
<!--#include virtual="/infonetIniFiles/header.ini" -->

I reference an image which is in the ANT-directory as follows:
IMG> SRC="/image/choice.gif" BORDER="0" USEMAP="#Choice" WIDTH="469" 
HEIGHT="280">

Tomcat can execute the SSI, but it CANNOT find the image.

text:
I'm not a committer (I don't even play one on TV... sorry old joke)...

This isn't a bug.

<!--#include virtual="/infonetIniFiles/header.ini" -->

Is interpretted by the server, where as img tags...

<img src="/images/choice.gif"... >
...are interpretted by the browser.  A configuration flag lets the SSI #include 
work relative to the webapp, but this essentially means that the SSI servlet 
sticks the context path on the front before reading the file.

For IMG tags, the browser asks for /images/choice.gif.  The server has no way of 
knowing that the browser really wants /ANT/images/choice.gif.  Indeed, the 
servlet engine never really comes into play here since choice.gif is a static 
resource.
Not a bug. You have to specify which directory the image is in or the html page has to be in the same directory as the image. Try in ANT directory or from the root.
creator: amyroh@apache.org
